page.title: 10 All Saints Ch.-cont
page.content: {All Saints Church-Cont contains five complete pillars and five made of pieces of stone.They have decorated gothic arches.The wooden roof was renewed in 1952 at the cost of Â£1,741.It is made of very big pieces of oak timber.The bell tower is younger.There is a very big wooden chest inside the church. It was used to keep treasures so that they would not be stolen.Inside the porch is a Roman altar.There is a plaque on the wall to commemorate George Hedley,the inventor of the Puffing Billy Locomative.On the back wall is an iron ring and a chain to which Bibles were once fastened.In the church we had to find some mice on the pews.All of the mice were carved by Mr.Thompson of Yorkshire.There was one mouse on the leg and one on of the seat of the pew that I looked at.
